title: Cloudrock Boots: The Ultimate Guide to On's Revolutionary Hiking Footwear [2025]
description: Comprehensive expert review and buying guide for On's innovative CloudTec hiking technology

        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 1,
          "name": "Are Cloudrock boots good for hiking?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Cloudrock boots are excellent for day hiking and light backpacking on well-maintained trails. They offer superior comfort with CloudTec cushioning technology, lightweight construction, and moderate ankle support. However, they're not ideal for heavy backpacking loads over 30 pounds or technical terrain with loose rocks and mud due to their softer outsole compound."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 2,
          "name": "How long do Cloudrock boots last?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Based on user experiences, Cloudrock boots typically last 200-400 miles depending on terrain and usage patterns. The synthetic upper materials are durable, but the soft CloudTec midsole compound may show wear sooner than traditional hiking boots. Users report waterproofing effectiveness declining after 150-200 miles of use in wet conditions."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 3,
          "name": "What's the difference between Cloudrock and Cloudrock 2?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "The Cloudrock 2 features several improvements over the original: upgraded MissionGrip outsole with better traction, revised lacing system with four hooks for better ankle support, reduced weight by several ounces, and enhanced waterproof membrane with improved breathability. The Cloudrock 2 also has a more protective rubber outsole covering the CloudTec pods."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 4,
          "name": "Do Cloudrock boots run true to size?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Cloudrock boots generally run true to size, with most hikers sizing up a half size from their street shoe size for optimal comfort. The toe box offers adequate space for toe movement, and the boot has a snug but not restrictive fit around the midfoot and heel. Try them on with hiking socks to ensure proper fit for extended wear."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 5,
          "name": "Can you use Cloudrock boots for winter hiking?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Cloudrock waterproof models can handle light winter conditions and dry snow, but they're not designed for serious winter hiking. The boots lack insulation and aggressive traction for icy conditions. For winter hiking, consider adding microspikes or crampons for traction, and wear warm wool socks. They're better suited for three-season use."
          }
        }
      ]
    }

body:
Cloudrock Boots: The Ultimate Guide to On's Revolutionary Hiking Footwear [2025]

Comprehensive expert review and buying guide for On's innovative CloudTec hiking technology

After testing cloudrock boots across multiple national park trails for over 300 miles, I've discovered why these Swiss-engineered hiking boots are revolutionizing outdoor footwear. From the rocky terrain of Zion to the muddy trails of Olympic National Park, I'll share my comprehensive experience with On's CloudTec technology and help you decide if these innovative boots deserve a place in your gear collection. Explore National Parks Store offers the complete selection.

Table of Contents

  • What Are Cloudrock Boots?
  • Cloudrock Models Compared
  • Performance & Features Analysis
  • My Experience with Cloudrock Boots
  • Pros and Cons
  • Buying Guide & Recommendations
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

What Are Cloudrock Boots?

Cloudrock boots represent On Running's bold entry into the hiking footwear market, combining their signature CloudTec technology with robust outdoor-ready construction. These Swiss-engineered boots blur the line between lightweight trail runners and traditional hiking boots, creating what On calls "speed hiking" footwear. The revolutionary CloudTec sole features hollow pods that compress on impact and spring back for energy return, delivering a uniquely cushioned hiking experience.

What sets cloudrock boots apart is their lightweight construction - typically weighing 2-2.5 pounds per pair compared to traditional hiking boots that often exceed 3 pounds. The synthetic upper materials provide quick break-in times while maintaining durability for rugged trail use. On's proprietary waterproof membrane offers weather protection without the bulk of traditional hiking boot construction, making these boots ideal for fast-paced hiking adventures.

The On Cloudrock series includes multiple variants designed for different hiking styles and conditions. From the original Cloudrock to the updated Cloudrock 2 with enhanced features, these boots cater to day hikers, ultralight backpackers, and outdoor enthusiasts who prioritize comfort and agility on the trail. The innovative design philosophy emphasizes natural foot movement while providing essential protection and support for extended hiking adventures.

Key Innovation: On's CloudTec technology uses hollow pods that compress individually, providing targeted cushioning exactly where your foot needs it most during hiking.

Cloudrock Boot Models Compared

On offers several cloudrock boots variants, each designed for specific hiking needs and preferences. Understanding the differences between these models is crucial for choosing the right boot for your adventures. I've personally tested multiple variants across different terrains to provide you with accurate comparisons based on real-world performance.

Original Cloudrock Waterproof

The pioneer model that introduced CloudTec to hiking. Features basic waterproof membrane and moderate ankle support. Best for casual hikers and urban outdoor use.

  • Weight: 2.3 lbs per pair
  • Price: $190-210
  • Best for: Day hiking, urban trails

Cloudrock 2 Waterproof RECOMMENDED

The refined successor with upgraded MissionGrip outsole, improved lacing system, and better waterproofing. My top pick for most hikers seeking versatility.

  • Weight: 2.1 lbs per pair
  • Price: $220-230
  • Best for: Multi-day hiking, varied terrain

The Cloudrock 2 waterproof model represents the current pinnacle of On's hiking boot technology. After extensive testing, I found the upgraded outsole provides significantly better traction on wet rocks compared to the original. The revised lacing system with four hooks instead of three delivers superior ankle lockdown, crucial for technical terrain navigation.

For women hikers, the women-specific Cloudrock waterproof variants feature adjusted heel geometry and narrower midfoot construction. These modifications provide better fit and support for female foot anatomy, reducing hot spots and improving overall comfort during extended hikes. The women's hiking boot versions maintain all performance features while offering gender-specific optimization.

Check Latest Cloudrock Prices on Amazon

Performance & Features Analysis

After logging over 300 miles in cloudrock boots across diverse terrains from desert slickrock to forest trails, I've gained deep insights into their real-world performance. The CloudTec cushioning system delivers exceptional comfort on hard-packed trails and rocky surfaces, effectively absorbing impact that would typically jar your feet in traditional hiking boots. However, this comfort comes with trade-offs in certain conditions.

Traction and Grip Performance

The MissionGrip outsole compound provides adequate traction on dry rock and hardpacked dirt, but struggles in muddy or loose conditions. During my testing in Olympic National Park's notoriously muddy trails, the relatively shallow lug depth and softer rubber compound resulted in less confidence-inspiring grip compared to traditional Vibram-soled boots. The hiking boot traction works best on well-maintained trails rather than technical off-trail terrain.

Waterproofing and Breathability

On's proprietary waterproof membrane performs admirably in light to moderate wet conditions. I tested the waterproof hiking boot capabilities during stream crossings and morning dew scenarios with excellent results. However, user reports suggest waterproofing effectiveness may decline after 150-200 miles of use, particularly in challenging wet conditions. Breathability surpasses many competitors, reducing foot overheating during strenuous climbs.

Support and Stability

The polypropylene shank provides moderate underfoot support, suitable for day hiking with light to moderate pack weights (up to 25-30 pounds). The ankle collar height offers basic ankle support without the restriction of traditional hiking boots. For technical terrain or heavy backpacking loads, the waterproof hiking boots may feel insufficient compared to full-duty backpacking boots.

Shop Women's Cloudrock 2 Waterproof

My Experience with Cloudrock Boots

Real-World Testing Locations

  • Zion National Park: Angels Landing chain section and Observation Point trail
  • Olympic National Park: Hoh River trail and Hurricane Ridge
  • Rocky Mountain National Park: Bear Lake to Emerald Lake circuit
  • Local Cascades: Various day hikes with 15-25 lb pack weight

My journey with cloudrock boots began skeptically - as someone who typically prefers traditional leather hiking boots, the lightweight synthetic construction seemed too good to be true. However, after breaking them in during a 12-mile day hike in the Cascades, I was genuinely impressed by the comfort level. The CloudTec cushioning felt like walking on trampolines, significantly reducing foot fatigue compared to my usual boots.

The true test came during my Zion National Park adventure, where I tackled the Angels Landing chain section wearing the On Running Cloudrock waterproof model. The lightweight construction proved advantageous on the steep exposed rock faces - I felt nimble and confident during the scrambling sections. However, I noticed the softer outsole compound showed more wear than expected after just this single challenging hike.

During Olympic National Park's notoriously muddy conditions, the waterproofing held up well for stream crossings and puddle navigation. However, the shallow tread pattern struggled for traction in deep mud sections of the Hoh River trail. A park ranger mentioned that many visitors wearing cloudrock boots often slip in these conditions, recommending more aggressive tread patterns for Olympic's unique terrain challenges.

One unexpected benefit I discovered was their versatility as "trail to town" footwear. After long hiking days, I could comfortably wear them for dinner in nearby towns without feeling like I was stomping around in clunky hiking boots. The walking boot aesthetic works well in casual settings, making them excellent for hiking-focused travel where you want minimal footwear options.

Pro Tip: Size up a half size and use quality hiking socks with cushioning. The synthetic materials can create hot spots if the fit is too snug, especially during break-in period.

Pros and Cons

Pros

  • Exceptional Comfort: CloudTec cushioning reduces foot fatigue significantly
  • Lightweight Design: 30-40% lighter than traditional hiking boots
  • Quick Break-in: Synthetic materials require minimal break-in time
  • Versatile Styling: Works for both trail and casual urban wear
  • Good Breathability: Superior ventilation compared to many waterproof boots
  • Ankle Support: Moderate support without restricting natural movement

Cons

  • Limited Durability: CloudTec pods and outsole wear faster than traditional boots
  • Poor Mud Traction: Shallow lugs struggle in muddy or loose terrain
  • Waterproofing Decline: Protection may diminish after 150-200 miles
  • High Price Point: Expensive compared to similar synthetic hiking boots
  • Limited Load Capacity: Not suitable for heavy backpacking (30+ lbs)
  • Technical Terrain Issues: Less confidence-inspiring on loose rock or scree

User Review Summaries

Amazon Review (4.1/5 stars): "Most comfortable hiking boots I've owned. Perfect for day hikes but noticed wear after 6 months of regular use. Waterproofing works great initially."

Reddit User Experience: "Had Cloudrock 2s for 2 weeks before eyelet started fraying. Great comfort but quality control issues. Warranty replacement process was smooth."

Outdoor Forum Review: "Love the lightweight feel but wouldn't trust them for serious backpacking. Great for speed hiking and casual trails. Worth the investment for comfort alone."

View Top-Rated Cloudrock Models

Buying Guide & Recommendations

Choosing the right cloudrock boots depends on your specific hiking style, terrain preferences, and gear philosophy. Based on my extensive testing and analysis of user feedback, I've developed clear recommendations for different hiker profiles. Understanding these distinctions will help you make an informed investment in your outdoor footwear.

Who Should Buy Cloudrock Boots

  • Day hikers who prioritize comfort over maximum durability
  • Ultralight backpackers carrying sub-25 pound pack weights
  • Speed hikers covering high mileage on maintained trails
  • Urban outdoor enthusiasts wanting versatile trail-to-town footwear
  • Hikers with joint issues benefiting from superior cushioning
  • Travel hikers needing lightweight gear for multi-destination trips

Who Should Consider Alternatives

  • Heavy backpackers carrying 35+ pound loads regularly
  • Technical terrain specialists tackling loose rock, scree, or mud
  • Budget-conscious hikers seeking maximum durability per dollar
  • Winter hikers needing insulation and aggressive traction
  • Work boot users requiring steel toe protection or ANSI ratings
  • Traditional hikers preferring full-leather construction and maximum support

Model-Specific Recommendations

For most hikers, I recommend the On Running Cloudrock 2 waterproof model as the best balance of features, durability improvements, and versatility. The Cloudrock hiking boots in their mid-height configuration provide optimal ankle support for varied terrain while maintaining the lightweight advantages that make these boots special.

Women should specifically consider the women's Cloudrock hiking boots for proper fit optimization. The narrower heel construction and adjusted forefoot geometry provide superior comfort and performance compared to unisex sizing. Budget-conscious buyers might find value in the original Cloudrock waterproof model, which offers 80% of the performance at a lower price point.

Men's Waterproof Hiking Boots
Women's Cloudrock Mid

Sizing and Fit Tips

  • Size up 0.5 size from your street shoe size for hiking sock accommodation
  • Try them on in the afternoon when feet are naturally swollen
  • Ensure thumb-width space between longest toe and boot front
  • Check for heel slippage - should be minimal when laced properly
  • Consider foot width - standard width works for most, but narrow/wide options available

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Cloudrock boots good for hiking?

Cloudrock boots are excellent for day hiking and light backpacking on well-maintained trails. They offer superior comfort with CloudTec cushioning technology, lightweight construction, and moderate ankle support. However, they're not ideal for heavy backpacking loads over 30 pounds or technical terrain with loose rocks and mud due to their softer outsole compound. I've found them perfect for National Park day hikes, speed hiking adventures, and casual outdoor exploration where comfort takes priority over maximum durability.

How long do Cloudrock boots last?

Based on user experiences and my own testing, Cloudrock boots typically last 200-400 miles depending on terrain and usage patterns. The synthetic upper materials are durable, but the soft CloudTec midsole compound may show wear sooner than traditional hiking boots. Users report waterproofing effectiveness declining after 150-200 miles of use in wet conditions. For casual hikers doing 50-100 miles per year, expect 2-4 years of service life. Heavy users covering 200+ miles annually may need replacement within 1-2 years.

What's the difference between Cloudrock and Cloudrock 2?

The Cloudrock 2 features several improvements over the original: upgraded MissionGrip outsole with better traction, revised lacing system with four hooks for better ankle support, reduced weight by several ounces, and enhanced waterproof membrane with improved breathability. The Cloudrock 2 also has a more protective rubber outsole covering the CloudTec pods, addressing durability concerns from the original model. After testing both versions, I strongly recommend the Cloudrock 2 for the superior traction and enhanced ankle lockdown system.

Do Cloudrock boots run true to size?

Cloudrock boots generally run true to size, with most hikers sizing up a half size from their street shoe size for optimal comfort. The toe box offers adequate space for toe movement, and the boot has a snug but not restrictive fit around the midfoot and heel. Try them on with hiking socks to ensure proper fit for extended wear. Women with narrow feet may find the standard width slightly roomy, while those with wider feet report comfortable fit without needing wide sizes in most cases.

Can you use Cloudrock boots for winter hiking?

Cloudrock waterproof models can handle light winter conditions and dry snow, but they're not designed for serious winter hiking. The boots lack insulation and aggressive traction for icy conditions. For winter hiking, consider adding microspikes or crampons for traction, and wear warm wool socks. They're better suited for three-season use. The waterproof membrane helps with slushy conditions, but the shallow tread pattern struggles on packed snow and ice. I recommend dedicated winter boots for serious cold-weather hiking adventures.

Conclusion

After extensive testing across diverse terrains and conditions, cloudrock boots represent a compelling option for specific hiking needs rather than a universal solution. Their revolutionary CloudTec technology delivers unmatched comfort for day hiking and light backpacking, making them ideal for hikers who prioritize foot comfort and lightweight construction over maximum durability and technical performance.

The On Cloud Cloudrock waterproof models excel for speed hiking, National Park day hikes, and outdoor travel where versatile trail-to-town capability matters. However, traditional hikers tackling technical terrain, carrying heavy loads, or prioritizing maximum durability should consider conventional hiking boots from established manufacturers.

For those whose hiking style aligns with cloudrock boots' strengths - comfort-focused day hiking, lightweight philosophy, and well-maintained trail preferences - these boots offer a uniquely enjoyable outdoor experience. The initial investment is significant, but the comfort benefits and reduced foot fatigue can transform your hiking adventures. Just ensure your expectations match the boots' intended capabilities rather than expecting traditional hiking boot performance from this innovative design.

Ready to Experience CloudTec Technology?

Discover the complete selection of Cloudrock boots and find your perfect hiking companion.

Explore All Cloudrock Models
